intro: Chorisanthera hispida, commonly known as the roughleaf choralis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Chorisanthera hispida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
